thread.title: Wells Fargo Risk Chief to Retire as Scrutiny of the Bank Continues

author: Emily Glazer
title: Wells Fargo Risk Chief to Retire as Scrutiny of the Bank Continues
text:
Wells Fargo & Co.’s Chief Risk Officer Mike Loughlin is retiring as the bank continues to face heightened regulatory scrutiny, especially over its risk- management practices.
The San Francisco-based bank said Wednesday it will name a successor to Mr. Loughlin in “the next few months,” and he will remain in his role through the transition.
The... RELATED VIDEO A Brief History of Retail Banking The retail banking industry is undergoing another major shift, and the future looks high-tech, sophisticated, and, for big banks, very urban.
